response.value:
Adkar model

These model was discovered by Jeffhiatt in 2003 . These model is entirely based on a situation wear organisation fail at implementing change because they had not put enough afford . These model is different from other model as most of the model has focus on the whole organisation or industry where as , these model focus on individual by attempting then to adapt to the change.

There are five important elements to these model

Awareness : This first stage of the model the information is finalised to the individual. people are motivated or inspired that the change is necessary for the betterment of orgastation of future.

Desire : After individuals aware of the necessity they strongly desire the change to happen.

Knowledge: This element refers that , people involved in the change should be made fully aware of the circumstances and essential information of the change .

Ability : After everyone is aware or have access to full information regarding the change , they need to acquire the skills or ability to implement it .

Reinforcement: After the individual acquired the skills required ,the change is maintained or sustained by keeping the employees up-to date regarding the change . This is done in order to make the change look normal.

data.stimulus: Can you reflect on any change management model
